windowTitle.description: Title of the application window, usually not translated

autoConnectEnabled.message: Auto-Connect: Enabled - Configurator automatically tries to connect when new port is detected

autoConnectDisabled.message: Auto-Connect: Disabled - User needs to select the correct serial port and click "Connect" button on its own

userLanguageSelect.message: Language (need to restart the application for the changes to take effect)

checkForConfiguratorUnstableVersions.message: Show update notifications for unstable versions of the configurator

configuratorUpdateNotice.message:
You are using an outdated version of the Embedded Node.
Version $1 is available online, please visit the release page to download and install the latest version with fixes and improvements.
Please close the configurator window before updating.

serialUnrecoverable.message: Unrecoverable failure of serial connection, disconnecting...

noConfigurationReceived.message: No configuration received within 10 seconds, communication failed

infoVersions.description: Message that appears in the GUI log panel indicating operating system, Chrome version and Configurator version

buildServerLoaded.message: Loaded builds information for $1 from build server.

buildServerLoadFailed.message: Build server query for $1 releases failed, using cached information. Reason: $2

releaseCheckLoaded.message: Loaded release information for $1 from GitHub.

releaseCheckFailed.message: GitHub query for $1 releases failed, using cached information. Reason: $2

releaseCheckCached.message: Using cached release information for $1 releases.

notifications_click_here_to_start_app.message: Click here to start the application

defaultWelcomeIntro.message: Welcome to Embedded Node - Configurator, a utility designed to simplify updating and configuring your embedded application.

defaultQuickStartText.message: 1. Enter device ID. <li>2. Choose serial port. <li>3. Choose baudrate.<li>4. Click Connect button.

defaultWelcomeText.message:
The application supports all hardware with implemented Embedded node protocol.

The Embedded node protocol wiki is a great resource for information, it can be found here.

defaultContributingText.message:
If you would like to help make Embedded node even better you can help in many ways, including:
  • Testing new features/fixes and providing feedback.
  • Helping out with issues and commenting on feature requests.
  • Collaborate by translating the configurator application into your language.

defaultDonateText.message:
Embedded node is software that is open source and is available free of charge without warranty to all users.
If you found the ENP or Embedded node configurator useful, please consider supporting its development by donating.

defaultDocumentation.message: Embedded node documentation is available in release notes and wiki.

defaultDocumentation1.message: The Embedded node protocol wiki is a great resource for information, it can be found here.

firmwareFlasherWarningText.message:
Do not disconnect the board or turn off your computer while flashing.

Note: Bootloader is stored in flash memory, it can be bricked.
Note: Make sure you have a backup; some upgrades/downgrades will wipe your configuration.
Note: Make sure that current firmware supports firmware download.

firmwareFlasherRecoveryText.message:
If you have lost communication with your board follow these steps to restore communication:
  • Power off
  • Power on
  • Install all drivers if required.
  • Close configurator, Close all running chrome instances, Close all Chrome apps, Restart Configurator.
  • Flash with correct firmware.
  • Power off.
  • Power on.
  • Connect normally.

firmwareFlasherHexCorrupted.message: HEX file appears to be corrupted

firmwareFlasherRemoteFirmwareLoaded.message: Remote Firmware loaded, ready for flashing

firmwareFlasherWritePermissions.message: You don't have write permissions for this file

firmwareFlasherPreviousDevice.message: Detected: $1 - previous device still flashing, please replug to try again
